file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 33-50-04-04 - BATTERY POWER SUPPLY - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL BATTERY POWER SUPPLY - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the Battery Power Supply. B. The Battery Power Supply gives DC power supply to the electrically-illuminated-emergency exit signal and lights when the normal electrical power supply is lost. C. The Battery Power Supply includes a battery pack and an electronic assembly mounted on a chassis. D. There are four Battery Power Supplies installed on the aircraft as follows: (1) Battery Power Supply 1 - Installed on the right side of the fuselage, between the TCAS computer and the cockpit wall. (2) Battery Power Supply 2 - Installed at the ceiling, above the service door. (3) Battery Power Supply 3 - Installed below the floor panel (on the single-passenger seat side). (4) Battery Power Supply 4 - Installed at the ceiling (third passenger window, after the emergency exit). E. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 33-50-04-000-801-A BATTERY POWER SUPPLY - REMOVAL BATTERY POWER SUPPLY - INSTALLA- ALL 33-50-04-400-801-A TION ALL 33-50-04-000-802-A BATTERY PACK - REMOVAL ALL 33-50-04-400-802-A BATTERY PACK - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 33-50-04 Page 1 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the EMERG circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). (2) For Battery Power Supply 1: (a) Remove the internal access panel from the wardrobe. (b) (PRE-MOD. S.B.145-25-0325) Remove the insulation. Refer to (AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-802-A/400), as applicable. (3) For Battery Power Supply 2: (a) Remove the headliner. Refer to (AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-802-A/400), as applicable. (b) (PRE-MOD. S.B.145-25-0325) Remove the insulation. Refer to (AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-801-A/400)) or (AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-802-A/400), as applicable. (4) Battery Power Supply 3: (a) Remove the passenger seat installed on floor panel 251JF (AMM TASK 25-21-01-000-801-A/400), if applicable. (b) Remove passenger-cabin floor panel 251JF. Refer to (AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-802-A/400), as applicable. (5) Battery Power Supply 4: (a) Remove the headliner. Refer to (AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-802-A/400), as applicable. (b) (PRE-MOD. S.B.145-25-0325) Remove the insulation. Refer to (AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-802-A/400), as applicable. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the battery pack ( AMM TASK 33-50-04-000-802-A/400). (2) Remove the bolts (5) that attach the chassis assembly (6). (3) (PRE-MOD. S.B.145-25-0325) Remove the chassis assembly (6). (4) (POST-MOD. S.B.145-25-0325) Remove the chassis assembly (6), the bonding strap (4), and the spacers (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-50-04 Page 3 of 14 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In the passenger cabin I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) (PRE-MOD. S.B.145-25-0325) To install the battery power supply, do as follows: (a) Do the bonding procedures, method 3 (AMM TASK 20-13-21-910-801-A/200). (b) Put the chassis assembly (6) in its installation position. (c) Install the bolts (5) to attach the chassis assembly (6). (d) Do the bonding test (AMM TASK 20-13-21-700-801-A/200). (e) Do the bonding protection ( AMM TASK 20-13-21-910-802-A/200). (f) Install the battery pack ( AMM TASK 33-50-04-400-802-A/400). (2) (POST-MOD. S.B.145-25-0325) To install the battery power supply, do as follows: (a) Do the bonding procedures, method 4 (AMM TASK 20-13-21-910-801-A/200). NOTE: Use the best joining point to prepare and to do the bonding procedures. (b) Put the blanket (2), bonding strap (4), spacers (3), and the chassis assembly (6) in their positions. (c) Install the bolts (5) to attach the chassis assembly (6), spacers (3), and bonding strap (4) to their support (1). (d) Do the bonding test (AMM TASK 20-13-21-700-801-A/200). (e) Do the bonding protection ( AMM TASK 20-13-21-910-802-A/200). (f) Install the battery pack ( AMM TASK 33-50-04-400-802-A/400). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) For Battery Power Supply 1: (a) (PRE-MOD. S.B.145-25-0325) Install the insulation. Refer to (AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-802-A/400), as applicable. (b) Install the internal access panel to the wardrobe. (2) For Battery Power Supply 2: (a) (PRE-MOD. S.B.145-25-0325) Install the insulation. Refer to (AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-802-A/400), as applicable. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-50-04 Page 7 of 14 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (b) Install the headliner. Refer to (AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-802-A/400), as applicable. (3) For Battery Power Supply 3: (a) Install passenger-cabin floor panel 251JF. Refer to (AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-802-A/400), as applicable. (b) Install the passenger seat installed on floor panel 251JF (AMM TASK 25-21-01-400-801-A/400), if applicable. (4) For Battery Power Supply 4: (a) (PRE-MOD. S.B.145-25-0325) Install the insulation. Refer to (AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-802-A/400), as applicable. (b) Install the headliner. Refer to (AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-802-A/400), as applicable. (5) On the circuit breaker panel, close the EMERG circuit breaker and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). (6) Do the Emergency-Lighting-System operational check ( AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-50-04 Page 8 of 14 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the EMERG circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). (2) For Battery Power Supply 1: (a) Remove the internal access panel from the wardrobe. (b) (PRE-MOD. S.B.145-25-0325) Remove the insulation. Refer to (AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-802-A/400), as applicable. (3) For Battery Power Supply 2: (a) Remove the headliner. Refer to (AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-802-A/400), as applicable. (b) (PRE-MOD. S.B.145-25-0325) Remove the insulation. Refer to (AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-801-A/400)) or (AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-802-A/400), as applicable. (4) Battery Power Supply 3: (a) Remove the passenger seat installed on floor panel 251JF (AMM TASK 25-21-01-000-801-A/400), if applicable. (b) Remove passenger-cabin floor panel 251JF. Refer to (AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-802-A/400), as applicable. (5) Battery Power Supply 4: (a) Remove the headliner. Refer to (AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-22-04-000-802-A/400), as applicable. (b) (PRE-MOD. S.B.145-25-0325) Remove the insulation. Refer to (AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-802-A/400), as applicable. J. Removal (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-003-A (1) Release the two Dzus fasteners (1). CAUTION: DO NOT LIFT THE BATTERY PACK (2) BEFORE YOU MOVE IT AWAY FROM THE ELECTRONIC ASSEMBLY. THIS IS TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE PIN-TYPE CONTACTS OF THE ELECTRONIC ASSEMBLY. (2) Carefully move the battery pack (2) rearward to disconnect it. (3) Remove the battery pack (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-50-04 Page 10 of 14 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-003-A CAUTION: DO NOT LIFT THE BATTERY PACK (2) AFTER YOU MATE THE PIN-AND- SOCKET-TYPE CONTACTS. THIS IS TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE PIN CONTACTS OF THE ELECTRONIC ASSEMBLY. (1) Put the battery pack (2) in its installation position on the chassis assembly (3). (2) Push the battery pack (2) forward to connect it. (3) Attach the two Dzus fasteners (1). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) For Battery Power Supply 1: (a) (PRE-MOD. S.B.145-25-0325) Install the insulation. Refer to (AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-802-A/400), as applicable. (b) Install the internal access panel to the wardrobe. (2) For Battery Power Supply 2: (a) (PRE-MOD. S.B.145-25-0325) Install the insulation. Refer to (AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-802-A/400), as applicable. (b) Install the headliner. Refer to (AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-802-A/400), as applicable. (3) For Battery Power Supply 3: (a) Install passenger-cabin floor panel 251JF. Refer to (AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-802-A/400), as applicable. (b) Install the passenger seat installed on floor panel 251JF (AMM TASK 25-21-01-400-801-A/400), if applicable. (4) For Battery Power Supply 4: (a) (PRE-MOD. S.B.145-25-0325) Install the insulation. Refer to (AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-802-A/400), as applicable. (b) Install the headliner. Refer to (AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-801-A/400) or (AMM TASK 25-22-04-400-802-A/400), as applicable. (5) On the circuit breaker panel, close the EMERG circuit breaker and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). (6) Do the Emergency-Lighting-System operational check ( AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 33-50-04 Page 14 of 14 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
